articles.content:
Just Struggle of Korean People Supported 
   Pyongyang, July 5 (KCNA) -- The Afro-Asian People's Solidarity Organization made public a statement on June 28 on the occasion of the month of international solidarity with the Korean people. We express firm solidarity with the friendly Korean people in their cause of justice to prevent war and defend peace in the Korean Peninsula, it said.
 More than half a century has passed since a war broke out in Korea, the statement said, pointing out that they strongly oppose all sorts of war of aggression on the earth and holding that a war should not break out again in the Korean Peninsula.    
 Korea should be certainly reunified in the near future on the three principles of independence, peaceful reunification and great national unity as desired by the whole Korean nation, stressed the statement.

Greetings to President of Malawi
articles.content:
Greetings to President of Malawi 
   Pyongyang, July 5 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Tuesday sent a message of greetings to Bingu Wa Mutarika, president of Malawi, on the occasion of the 42nd anniversary of its independence.
 In the message Kim extended warm congratulations to the president and the friendly people of Malawi.

articles.title: Congratulations to 4th Party Congress of Equatorial Guinea
articles.content:
Congratulations to 4th Party Congress of Equatorial Guinea
   Pyongyang, July 5 (KCNA) -- The Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea sent a congratulatory message to the 4th Congress of the Democratic Party of Equatorial Guinea on Wednesday.
 The message expressed the belief that the congress will be an important occasion in the activities of the DPEG for defending the sovereignty of the country and achieving national unity and economic development.    
 It sincerely wished the party great success in its congress in the belief that the good relations of friendship and cooperation between the two parties and the two peoples would continue to develop favorably in the future, too.

articles.title: Greetings to President of Comoros
articles.content:
Greetings to President of Comoros
   Pyongyang, July 5 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on July 4 sent a message of greetings to Ahmed Abdallah Mohamed Sambi, president of Comoros, on the occasion of the 31st anniversary of its independence.
 The message wished the president success in his responsible work for the prosperity of the country, expressing the belief that the bilateral ties would grow stronger in mutual interests.
